abstract: Deborah Howell, pioneering editor and ombudsman at The Washington Post, dead at the age of 68.
snippet: Deborah Howell, pioneering editor and ombudsman at The Washington Post, dead at the age of 68.
lead_paragraph: Deborah Howell, former ombudsman of The Washington Post, Washington bureau chief of the Newhouse newspapers and executive editor of The St. Paul Pioneer Press, died in an accident in New Zealand on Friday. The accident, in which she was struck and killed by a car, happened while she was on a long-planned trip with her husband, C. Peter Magrath, the former president of the University of Minnesota. She was 68 at the time of her death, and while tragic, the fact that she died in the midst of one more adventure on a life-list full of them surprised no one who knew her.

headline.main: The Editor Everyone Should Have Had
